screen_desc: The screenshot shows the "Picture-in-picture" settings on a smartphone. It displays a list of apps, each with an indication of whether they are allowed to use picture-in-picture mode. The apps listed include Chrome, Google Play Movies & TV, Google Play services, Maps, and YouTube, with Google Play Movies & TV and YouTube currently allowed.
action_think: The user has already enabled the picture-in-picture feature for Google Play Movies & TV. The next step is to disable it for YouTube.
action_plan: click on the toggle switch for 'Allow picture-in-picture'
action_desc: click on the YouTube settings label located at the left and upper middle part of the screen.
action_result: The last action was to click on the "Google Play Movies & TV" settings, which allowed me to access its specific picture-in-picture settings. In the current screenshot, I have turned off the picture-in-picture feature for this app. This action has completed the user request because it disables this feature, as required by the user.
